holidays.name: Global Handwashing Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to increasing awareness and understanding about the importance of handwashing with soap as an effective and affordable way to prevent diseases and save lives.
holidays.origin: Established by Global Handwashing Partnership in 2008 to promote hygiene and reduce disease worldwide.
holidays.funFact: If everyone worldwide washed their hands properly, it could reduce diarrheal diseases by up to 50%!

holidays.name: White Cane Safety Day
holidays.description: A day to recognize the achievements of people who are blind or visually impaired and to promote awareness of the white cane as a tool of independence.
holidays.origin: Proclaimed in the United States in 1964 to honor the white cane as a symbol of independence for blind individuals.
holidays.funFact: The white cane was originally introduced in the early 20th century and revolutionized mobility for the blind.

holidays.name: I Love Lucy Day
holidays.description: A day celebrating the classic and beloved American television sitcom featuring Lucille Ball's iconic comedic talent.
holidays.origin: Commemorates the premiere of the first episode of 'I Love Lucy' which originally aired on October 15, 1951.
holidays.funFact: Lucille Ball performed her famous chocolate factory scene on the show, which remains one of the most memorable moments in TV history.

holidays.name: National Grouch Day
holidays.description: A fun occasion for those who embrace their inner grump to celebrate and own their grouchy mood without apologies!
holidays.origin: Started as a humorous unofficial day in the US to poke fun at grumpy personalities and moods.
holidays.funFact: This day encourages even the nicest people to let off some steam and be delightfully grouchy for a bit.
